page.title: 18 Shropshire Dialect
page.content: Shropshire dialect has almost died out but some people,mostly farmers and older farm workers,can be heard using the odd words.Quite a lot of the population of Corvedale still use the old dialect. Some examples of dialect are: annu-has not wunna-would not inna-is not munna-must not dunna-do not A sentence might go:You munna say dunna it inna polite you canna say inna cos it inna right.They also say buz-bus axd-asked summat-something ship-sheep oontitump-molehill antitump-anthill smarn/in-this morning. Some farm sayings and words: lapping-to wrap up a sheeps fleece pleaching-to hedge tidy farm-good farm.
